Get individual linear slope and mean values from longitudinal data

get_slopes_and_mean.Rd

Get individual linear slope and mean values from longitudinal data

Usage

get_slopes_and_mean(
  data,
  id_col = "id",
  outcome_col = "outcome",
  time_col = "time"
)

Arguments

data

a longitudinal data set

id_col

the column name corresponding to the ID variable in data. Default = "id"

outcome_col

the column name corresponding to the outcome variable in data. Default = "outcome"

time_col

the column name corresponding to the time variable in data. Default = "time"

Value

a tibble with id, performance_slope, and performance_mean columns. This is what is used as inputs for subsequent test_polynomial() and implement_polynomial() function calls (and can therefore be directly piped in without storing intermediate output)

Examples

# Create dummy data
n_participants = 5
n_timepoints = 3

set.seed(2222)

dummy <- data.frame(
  id = rep(1:n_participants, each = n_timepoints),
  timepoint = rep(1:n_timepoints, times = n_participants),
  performance = rnorm(n_participants * n_timepoints, mean = 0, sd = 1)
)

# Extract slopes and mean from dummy data
get_slopes_and_mean(
data = dummy,
id_col = "id",
time_col = "timepoint",
outcome_col = "performance"
)
#> # A tibble: 5 × 3
#>      id performance_slope performance_mean
#>   <int>             <dbl>            <dbl>
#> 1     1             1.04             0.780
#> 2     2            -0.506            0.281
#> 3     3             0.892            1.10 
#> 4     4            -1.06             0.827
#> 5     5             1.07            -0.853
